uk.ac.ox.comlab.diadem.oxpath.output
Class OXPathXMLOutputHandler

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      uk.ac.ox.comlab.diadem.oxpath.output.OXPathOutputHandler
          uk.ac.ox.comlab.diadem.oxpath.output.OXPathXMLOutputHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class OXPathXMLOutputHandler
extends OXPathOutputHandler

Used to handle output from OXPath expressions and return the output as XML. This class has the disadvantage of handling all output in memory in order to build the document.

Author:
AndrewJSel

Constructor Detail

OXPathXMLOutputHandler

public OXPathXMLOutputHandler(java.lang.String host,
                              int port,
                              org.slf4j.Logger logger,
                              java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch iLatch)
Constructs the XMLOutputHandler object.

Parameters:
host - the host for the stream receiving OXPathExtractionNode instances
port - the port for the stream receiving OXPathExtractionNode instances
logger - the logging environment associated with OXPath
iLatch - countdown latch that lets the caller know that the XML output document is completely built
Method Detail

run

public void run()
Runs the thread receiving the OXPath output. Upon call to this.finishWithOuput(), all nodes received on the target output stream are built into an XML document. This process can be tested if finished with this.isDocumentBuilt(), at which point the output can received with this.returnDocument() or this.returnDocumentAsString().

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

isDocumentBuilt

public boolean isDocumentBuilt()
Returns true if the output Document is built; false otherwise.

Returns:
true if the output Document is built; false otherwise.

returnDocument

public org.w3c.dom.Document returnDocument()
Returns the output Document, as long as it has been built; returns null otherwise.

Returns:
the output Document, as long as it has been built; returns null otherwise.

returnDocumentAsString

public java.lang.String returnDocumentAsString()

Returns:
the output Document as a String, as long as it has been built; returns null otherwise.

getStringFromDocument
